data.title: We Found The 12 Best Places to Travel Solo in 2024
data.meta_description: What are the best destinations to embark on your next solo adventure? Look no further as our guide has you covered!
data.text:
Traveling solo can be an exhilarating adventure, allowing you to fully immerse yourself in new experiences, embracing the freedom to explore, and create indelible memories.

Undoubtedly, exploring the unknown at your own pace and getting out of your comfort zone helps you become more aware of your surroundings and trust your own gut.

However, choosing the optimal place to travel to on your next adventure can be a bit overwhelming since the opportunities are endless, and time is gold.

That’s why we have done our research to unravel some of the best destinations to travel solo and start your self-reflection journey.

Without further ado, let’s dive in!

1. Norway

Norway is a majestic place to travel solo, both in winter and in summer months.

You can visit it during the summer for warmer weather and lots of outdoor activities or between November and March to have a higher chance to see the Northern Lights.

In Oslo, you can explore the capital’s museums, and parks, or live fjord adventure whether by catamaran, boat, kayak, or stand-up paddleboard.

2. Portugal

Portugal is a captivating country with a rich history and unique landscapes, and an ideal destination to travel solo.

It boasts a wide range of activities a traveler can do, from exploring its medieval castles and palaces such as the National Palace of Pena, which crowns the hills of Sintra, to visiting cobblestone villages and golden beaches.

3. Ireland

Ireland, a destination with magnificent coastlines, lofty lighthouses, and rich greenery, is ideal to travel on your own and unwind.

In Dublin, you can embark on unique adventures such as visiting the Swords Castle, taking a literary walking tour of the UNESCO City of Literature, exploring its zoo and so many more.

Moreover, Galway, a place with idyllic scenery and amicable inhabitants, is not to be missed.

4. Scotland

Scotland offers a wealth of unique experiences, from roaming around historic cities to immersing yourself in breathtaking scenery.

It is an ideal place to jump on your upcoming solo adventure, creating your itinerary however you truly want.

You can start by exploring its capital, Edinburgh, which boasts a stunning castle, the Royal Mile, and the annual Edinburgh Festival, and then continue your exploration in Glasgow, known for its vibrant arts scene, museums, and lively streets.

As an alternative, you can hike the Isle of Skye, an underrated summer travel idea that will leave you breathless.

5. England

England is a solid choice for solo travelers that want to take solitary strolls along stunning cliffs, or down urban streets without any hindrances such as the language barrier.

Apart from the majestic and multicultural city of London, solo travelers can also opt for smaller charming English towns such as Huntingdon and Reading.

6. Iceland

Iceland which often goes by the name of “land of fire and ice” has no shortage of natural wonders and cultural attractions to immerse yourself in as a solo traveler.

It boasts an abundance of caves, black-sand beaches, waterfalls, and volcanoes, making it a haven for relaxation and rejuvenation for nature lovers.

The country’s majestic capital, Reykjavik, has spectacular landmarks such as Hallgrimskirkja church, the Harpa Concert Hall, and the interactive museum at Perlan.

Plus, it is considered one of the safest places for female solo travelers, with low crime rates, making it an ideal destination for your bucket list.

Let’s move on to the next destination on our list.

7. Slovenia

Slovenia, a small charming destination, is a top choice for solo travelers who want to visit a safe place with fairytale vibes.

Unlike other European cities, Ljubljana, Slovenia’s capital, offers spectacular scenery without hordes of tourists, allowing you to reconnect with yourself.

Plus, due to its small size, you can go anywhere on foot which can save you money.

8. Greece

Greece, a marvelous destination steeped in history, is ideal for solo travelers.

Whether you opt for its capital, Athens, or a remote Greek island such as Karpathos, to travel on your own, chances are you will fall in love.

Locals are friendly, the transportation options are numerous and the famous Greek cuisine lives up to its name.

9. Japan

Japan, a country where tradition meets modernity is known for its polite and friendly people, making it a great choice for your next solo travel adventure.

It offers a range of sights to choose from such as ancient temples, bustling cityscapes, tranquil gardens, and thrilling amusement parks.

Apart from its capital, Tokyo, which is known for its modern skyscrapers, you can hop on a bullet train and speed off to Kyoto, walk through towering bamboo forests, and dine on a traditional hot pot meal.

10. Singapore

Singapore, a destination that is a bit off the beaten path, offers a unique blend of old and new.

Its well-lit streets and safe public transportation system make it a safe option for solo visitors.

Whether you’re interested in cultural exploration, culinary delights, or stunning architecture, there’s something for every taste.

11. Thailand

Known as the “land of smiles,” Thailand is an ideal solo travel destination where locals welcome visitors with warm hospitality.

Thailand boasts a rich cultural heritage, including serene temples, traditional dance, and vibrant festivals.

Its vibrant capital, Bangkok, is a bustling metropolis known for its rich culture, street markets, and impressive temples.

Whether you spend your free time sampling Thailand’s famous street food or taking in scenic views at the beach, you will be mesmerized!

12. Canada

Canada is a perfect place to travel solo with no shortage of amazing things to do.

You can visit Canada and have a blast both during the winter and summer months, as long as you are prepared beforehand to pack the essentials for really low temperatures in winter, with the help of a travel checklist.

During the winter season, you are bound to experience the majestic mountains covered in snow and hit the slopes, while summer months are known for quite milder temperatures.

Let’s wrap things up with some final words.

Now Over to You

Solo travel offers numerous benefits, empowering people to rely on themselves, and becoming more independent and self-assured.

There is an abundance of destinations you can choose from to embark on your next solo adventure.

But before jumping on your new solo travel adventure, don’t forget to store your precious belongings somewhere safe!
